title: Lighthouse Execution engine call failed (not getting latest blocks)
body:
## System information
Architecture: x86_64
RAM: 16 GB
Memory: 2 TB (gp3)

## Description

I am using lighthouse with geth for extracting latest blocks but it seem stucked.

## Version
CL client & version: `Lighthouse v3.1.2-01e84b7`
EL client & version: `Geth v1.10.25`
OS & Version: Linux (ubuntu)

## Present Behaviour

It seems concensus client does not synced. Latest blocks are not loading up by geth. Also it is logging some error `ERRO Execution engine call failed `

## Expected Behaviour

Fully synced Lighthouse node with continously and smoothly processing latest blocks at geth side.

### Lighthouse Logs
````
lighthouse[72127]: Oct 07 14:57:05.986 WARN Error whilst processing payload status  error: Api { error: Reqwest(reqwest::Error { kind: Request, url: Url { scheme: "http", cannot_be_a_base: false, username: "", password: None, host: Some(Ipv4(54.160.175.215)), port: Some(8551), path: "/", query: None, fragment: None }, source: TimedOut }) }, service: exec
lighthouse[72127]: Oct 07 14:57:17.000 INFO Syncing                                 est_time: 3 hrs 31 mins, speed: 0.04 slots/sec, distance: 530 slots (1 hr 46 mins), peers: 86, service: slot_notifier
lighthouse[72127]: Oct 07 14:57:17.498 ERRO Execution engine call failed            error: Reqwest(reqwest::Error { kind: Request, url: Url { scheme: "http", cannot_be_a_base: false, username: "", password: None, host: Some(Ipv4(54.160.175.215)), port: Some(8551), path: "/", query: None, fragment: None }, source: TimedOut }), service: exec

lighthouse[72127]: Oct 07 14:57:17.498 CRIT Failed to update execution head         error: ExecutionForkChoiceUpdateFailed(EngineError(Api { error: Reqwest(reqwest::Error { kind: Request, url: Url { scheme: "http", cannot_be_a_base: false, username: "", password: None, host: Some(Ipv4(54.160.175.215)), port: Some(8551), path: "/", query: None, fragment: None }, source: TimedOut }) })), service: beacon
lighthouse[72127]: Oct 07 14:57:29.001 INFO Syncing                                 est_time: 3 hrs 32 mins, speed: 0.04 slots/sec, distance: 531 slots (1 hr 46 mins), peers: 80, service: slot_notifier
lighthouse[72127]: Oct 07 14:57:34.563 ERRO Execution engine call failed            error: Reqwest(reqwest::Error { kind: Request, url: Url { scheme: "http", cannot_be_a_base: false, username: "", password: None, host: Some(Ipv4(54.160.175.215)), port: Some(8551), path: "/", query: None, fragment: None }, source: TimedOut }), service: exec

````

````
geth[47114]: INFO [10-07|14:53:58.525] Generating state snapshot                root=b43ddd..2e0c86 in=492d8e..e54ce2 at=88eabc..0d7202 accounts=52,385,706 slots=228,849,174 storage=18.87GiB dangling=0 elapsed=6h40m16.492s eta=20h5m46.711s

geth[47114]: WARN [10-07|14:54:10.746] Served eth_call                          reqid=274786           duration=759.443146ms err="execution reverted"                     errdata=0xa14c4b50
geth[47114]: WARN [10-07|14:54:11.188] Served eth_call                          reqid=274798           duration="378.578µs"  err="execution reverted"

````

Lighthouse is not synced for last few hours and also logging errors as you can see. What is causing problem in it and how should I resolve it?
did you find a solution? started to experience this last couple of hours
@realsnick It's often an issue with Geth. If Geth is generating the state snapshot you just have to wait

I use Besu and there seems to be an issue with eth-docker enabling an early access snapshot feature. fixed it here https://github.com/eth-educators/eth-docker/pull/1085

my node is still synching 
update: synced and works

I've had similar issue (but my lighthouse finished syncing and there is no such error) and created a ticket at: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/26784, though I'm not sure if it's geth OR lighthouse issue
